ratings.comment: Terrible teacher, completely disorganized, doesn't know the answers to questions or where we were at even in the class. Took Zoology with him and it was the worst. Exams he wouldn't help give word banks at all for 200 question exams expecting you to memorize everything, lecture exams material is not what was covered. I would not take his class!

Don't really know what to say about the guy outside of the fact that he's extremely disorganized (as in writes the exams the night before disorganized) and his exams are too specific to the point of where you will not do well if you don't know everything 100%. His online quizzes are inconsistent with the textbook as well. Avoid.

I did not like him as an instructor.   He couldn't answer questions you asked because he didn't know the answer.   No study guide, "just know the concepts" WRONG. Some of the test questions were so specific if you didn't read the book you would have failed the test.  He is not very organized either.

Prof. Linder is probably the best lecturer I've ever had. Coming into the class with no interest in Tropical Ecology whatever, Prof. Linder managed to make it accessible and interesting. Tests are easy if you just go to class. Hardly ever use the textbook at all. Overall, great guy!

Dr. Linder is one of the best professors I've ever had.  He explains everything clearly and wants everyone to do well.  If you go to class, you'll know what he thinks is important and therefore show up on the exam.  Besides being an awesome professor, he is just a great guy.  Definitely take his class if you can.
Great guy! I had him for both Mammalogy and Tropical Ecology and he really make you think. He know the material well and is just a nice guy in general. as long as you go to lecture you'll be fine.
Great guy, really knows the material. If you put in some effort, you'll be fine.

Mammals. Awesome professor. Best bio prof I've had. Makes some mistakes but they all do. His teaching style actually makes you think. Knows his stuff, explains things well, got some great jokes. You learn a ton in the class. Lots of material so go to lecture. Lab taxonomy memorization sucks but I'd recommend him for sure

People need to chill. Prof Linder is a fine professor. It was his first time teaching the class so obviously some of the material was new to him too. Besides, when have you ever been able to do well in a class without putting in some of your own time too? Overall a decent professor and trust me I've had much, much worse.

Completely ineffective. Clearly has no clear understanding of the material himself (mispronounces everything, can't explain things well). Test covered materials not discussed in lecture even though reading the book is supposed to be optional (if you wanna do well on the exam you have to read it, they're straight from the publisher). I'd avoid him.

Eric Linder is hands down the worst professor I've ever had. I am very interested in Biology, but he did not inspire me to learn in any way. Avoid taking a class taught by him at all costs! His exams are not reflective of the material he expects us to know from lecture and he is unable to answer questions during class or office hours.
